column4: Does compiz not work with the default nvidia driver in lucid?
It works for me.  What's wrong with it?
are you using the proprietry nvidia driver?
Yeah, 64-bit.
i'm on 32. desktop zoom, animations on window open/close, swithc desktop animations etc aren't working for me. not sure why
Wobbly windows working?
nope
how do i check if i'm on 32 or 64bit?
i686...thats 64?
Flynsarmy- do a uname -a  inside a terminal
Out of curiousity- what card are you running?
how do i find that out :) 8600 gt i believe
on a laptop
FlynsArmy:  You should be able to look under Nvidia Settings.  System --> Administration --> NVidia X Server Settings
i don't have that
a package you installed yourself perhaps?
Nope
Does it show proprietary driver in use for the graphics card?
i'd say probably not because system - preferences - monitors is working. it doesn't if you use proprietry
Well without the proprietary drivers you won't get the effects.
thought you said you weren't on them and were getting the effects?
No,  I have the proprietary drivers turned on.  Without them, you won't get the effects.
